Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VinitaKunal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days. Nice and Clean property in an excellent location of Paris. Friendly staff always available for help. The main attraction was that metro station is just few steps away (200 mts). Will love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people for the price”
Reviews.Author: leex1080
Reviews.Content: We stay here for 7 nights. The room was small - but that is expected - but clean. We had a room with private shower and toilet. I thought the bathroom was pretty roomy to the hotel we stayed at later in our trip. There is always staff at hand so that was great. They were super nice and friendly. Only thing was the building next door was having construction done on it so it did get a little loud- no fault of the hotel. It was also in walking distance of the Metro so it was really central. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: AVLee34
Reviews.Content: This was a great find for us, both students travelling on a budget. The room was large and had a decent-sized bathroom for Paris. Everything was clean and simple with a welcoming family-run feel. Excellent location, Montparnasse is lively and central, but not a tourist trap. Paid around 80 euros/night for me and my boyfriend; much nicer than a hostel! We got a discount for staying on the main floor (still decent courtyard view from window) and 12 euros off for the third night. The concierge recommended a nice bistro, though the neighbourhood is filled with restuarants, cafes, bars, creperies, and bakeries of good quality - they aren't just filled with tourists. I would certianly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel and good bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: Jer_G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Agenor for five nights, while in Paris for business. The room I got was on the ground floor, just beside the entrance and the (very little) lobby and reception desk. Despite being right in front of the lobby, it was not as noisy as I was afraid of at first. The room was clean and it actually felt nice to be awaken by the noises coming from the kitchen where they were preparing the breakfast. The only down side of my room was the incredibly small bathroom, with a tiny shower and an even smaller sink. There are three points, however, where hotel Agenor stands out: the owner is very very friendly and he loves to chat with his guests, give suggestions on what to visit and where to go (and where not to go too). Coming from US, where everything is so anonymous, I found that point charming and refreshing. The second point is the price... the hotel itself is not luxurious, but it is a real bargain. The third point is location: being close to rue Daguerre (which is very picturesque), there are restaurants and shops where you can have a nice lunch/dinner for relatively modest prices, which in Paris is something really remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bostongirl15
Reviews.Content: After weeks of researching possible places to stay for first trip to Paris, stumbled upon a review for the Hotel Agenor. It was far cheaper than a lot of grungier looking hotels in less ideal neighborhoods. The room was small, but that is to be expected for Paris and the bathroom was surprisingly spacious. It was extremely clean and well kept. The staff were very friendly and helpful and it was a great place to come back to after long days trekking through the city. There are also a lot of great restaurants and several metro stations nearby. Also for history buffs, the Cimitiiere Montparnasse is right around the corner. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It has everything!”
Reviews.Author: fairbug
Reviews.Content: It is not near the river but it is walkable. Metro, train, and bus station are close. Farmers' market a block away - 2 days a week. There is a charming neighborhood walking street nearby with many bars, restaurants and shops. The hotel itself is very nice. The owners go out of their way to provide information on restaurants, directions and cultural activities. Very accommodating! There is a computer provided in the lobby for guests. The breakfast is excellent and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cmbknit
Reviews.Content: A lovely small moderately priced hotel tucked away on a quiet side street just off major roads, near public transportation to all points in Paris and Charles De Gaulle Airport. Numerous restaurants a short distance away, including Chez Papa, a real find for great food at moderate cost, recommended by the hotel owner. Room and bath were small, but very comfortable. No air conditioning, so summery may be warm. Breakfast only, but very good. Greatest assets are the proprietors, Francois and Frederique La Vaillant, who are very friendly, very knowledgeable about Paris, and always helpful. They are also very patient and answered our innumerable questions. A very nice experience that made our brief stay in Paris all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: marie2010Uk
Reviews.Content: At last we found a nice little hotel in Paris !! Nothing fancy about it but the staff is lovely, everything seems to be simple and clear. We stayed on the first floor so no need to get on the tiny tiny tiny little elevator ! The room was just the right size, facing the courtyard so almost no noise. The bed wasn't perfect but fine. The bathroom is a bit dated but again clean, fine. The area is great, 10 minutes on foot from Denfert (direct train from Roissy), same from Montparnasse...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: happyholidays88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great - the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and the location was good. A bit of a walk to the attractions but the metro was across the road and the walk through the streets were always interesting anyway. We will stay in this hotel again next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My feelings about this place are mixed.”
Reviews.Author: kitchenchemist
Reviews.Content: Pros - little elevator so stair climbing not necessary, free wifi, guest computer in lobby, soft toilet paper, husband spoke English well and was helpful, windows kept out street noise well. Cons - bed really low and hard, bathroom could have used some cosmetic touchup in the grout areas, wifi problem half a day, wife didn't speak English, high charge for breakfast, $120/night not a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Lunaprk
Reviews.Content: I found out about this hotel through Trip Advisor and the reviews were spot on. The hotel is on a quiet street just off a bustling avenue leading to the Montparnasse Tower & Train Station. I had the single room in the back on the ground floor. Aside from some mildew in the shower, the room was clean and comfortable. The staff were all cordial and helpful. All spoke either great or passable english. I for one appreciated the modest breakfast on mornings I wanted to get going quickly. When I got back late at night, a beer from the back fridge (2 euros) and using the WiFi were welcome amenities to wind down. The surrounding area while not really picturesque, was a great Parisian neighborhood with a nice mix of locals and tourists. A nice array of shops, bars and restaurants within a few blocks (not to mention the splendid Montparnasse Cemetery around the corner). I'll try to mention this under "nearby restaurants" but I must offer a rousing recommendation for "PlanB", a little cafe a couple blocks away (89 Rue Daguerre). Best food and staff on this visit. Little English spoken here but quite welcoming and friendly folks!

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkStef
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agenor combines great location, clean rooms and extremely accommodating service. We booked the hotel on parisinfo.com. We flew into Paris early in the morning. We took the RER in from the airport and got off at the Denfert Rochereau station, which is only about a 10 minute walk to the hotel. We arrived before noon, but the staff quickly got our room ready and let us in as soon as they could. The next morning, when jet-lag had slammed us pretty hard, we didn't get up until after 11am. It was a nice treat to not have a maid banging on the door like you might experience at other hotels. The staff were aware that we were still there and waited until we went out before cleaning the room. The room was a little on the smaller side, as expected, but very clean. The breakfast each morning consisted of croissants, bread, yoghurt, juice and coffee. And the staff all speak very fluent English and were all very helpful and offered suggestions on how to get around Paris. The hotel is situated on a quiet side street in the Montparnasse area. You are just a minute or so away from a busy, vibrant area with lots of restaurants. The Gaite Metro is just a 2 minute walk away and the Montparnasse Train Station is a less than 10 minute walk away. The hotel is quiet. The location is convenient to lot of things. And with the service and cleanliness, the Agenor Hotel has everything you could ask for. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: impstesting
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights from 21/03/08 till 26/03/08. The hotel has an excellent location in MontParnasse area. It is close to two metro stations Gaite and Edgar Quinet thus provides excellent connectivity. The owner family is nice and friendly. They guided us with valuable information for our everyday sight seeing. The room we stayed in was a double-room with bath-tub (you pay extra 6 euros per night for it) and was value for money. The bed was comfortable and room was cleaned daily with fresh toiletries in the toilet each day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone holidaying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chloque
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agenor is a clean, very well maintained and quiet hotel close to Gare Montparnasse in Paris. The room I stayed in was small, but everything was nice and clean. The personnel is nice and helpful, and there is free access to the internet, through the electricity plug (ask for the special the device and RJ45 cable at the reception). Very good value.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Agenor
HotelInfo.Address: 22 rue Cels | 14 Arr., 75014 Paris, France
